thread.title: Gold Coast Sea World dolphin show protest animal captivity | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Gold Coast Sea World dolphin show protest animal captivity | Daily Mail Online

author: Kate Darvall For Daily Mail Australia
title: Gold Coast Sea World dolphin show protest animal captivity | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share In the video, one audience member was heard yelling 'get out, we've paid to come and see this'. Another angry audience member confronted the activists and started to tear down the protest banners. The activists were quickly ushered out of the dolphin arena when the protest grew ugly The group interrupted the dolphin show at Sea World on the Gold Coast on Saturday, unfurling banners reading 'justice for captives' and 'free the dolphins' One activist was heard saying 'you're not allowed to touch us' during the confrontation. 'Don't support animal cruelty, your tickets support the slaughter of thousands of dolphins every year,' one protester said. The group was ushered out of the arena by off-duty police who claimed the protest was a criminal offence and the activists could be charged. The group was ushered out of the arena by off-duty police who claimed their protest was a criminal offence and they could be charged Some audience members are visibly unhappy with the protest, yelling at the activists The group obliged and left the dolphin show, but continued to chant 'there's no excuse for animal abuse'. 'Poor dolphins, I'm so sorry babies, we're trying,' one said. 'Sea World, shame on you. These dolphins deserve better, there's no shade here. 'I don't understand how anyone could work here, it's disgusting.' The protesters continued to chant as they were ushered out of the theme park. Sea World offers a dolphin show everyday, according to its website. The theme park also boasts a 'meet the dolphin' experience in which people are allowed to swim with the sea animals. Sea World also lists a research and rescue foundation on its website, dedicated to funding and promoting marine research projects. 'The foundation seeks to encourage and assist marine sciences and to date has supported over 180 research project relating to aspects of the biology of marine vertebrates selected by our Scientific Advisory Committee. Daily Mail Australia has reached out to Sea World for comment. The group of about 20 activists were ushered out of the dolphin arena before being kicked out of the theme park via the back entrance Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
